00022 /**
00023  * @file   QuantPlierBase.cpp
00024  * @author Pete Klosterman
00025  * @date   Wed Feb 22 10:55:22 2006
00026  * 
00027  * @brief  Base class for doing probe set quantification using either
00028  * the PLIER (Probe Logarithmic Error Intensity Estimate) method or
00029  * the ITER-PLIER method, which iteratively calls PLIER with the
00030  * probes that best correlate with signal estimate.
00031  */
00032 
00033 //
00034 #include "chipstream/QuantPlierBase.h"
00035 //
00036 #include "chipstream/QuantMethodFactory.h"
00037 
00038 using namespace std;
00039 
00040 /** 
00041  * @brief Does this quantification method estimate feature effects?
00042  * @return true or false if getFeatureEffects() supplies estimates.
00043  */
00044 bool QuantPlierBase::haveFeatureEffects() {
00045   return true;
00046 }
00047 
00048 /** 
00049  * @brief Does this quantification method supply residuals?
00050  * @return Return true if getResidual() works, false otherwise.
00051  */
00052 bool QuantPlierBase::haveResiduals() {
00053   return true;
00054 }
00055 
00056 /** 
00057  * @brief Get the feature effect of a particular probe.
00058  * @param probeIx - Index of probe in probe sets.
00059  * @return feature (probe) effects.
00060  */
00061 double QuantPlierBase::getFeatureEffect(unsigned int probeIx) { 
00062   assert(probeIx < m_ProbeCount);
00063   return m_ProbeEffects[probeIx];
00064 }
00065   
00066 /** 
00067  * @brief Get the estimated intensity for a chip. This is usually the data of
00068  * primary interest.
00069  * @param chipIx - Index of chip in experiment.
00070  * @return estimated intensity.
00071  */
00072 double QuantPlierBase::getTargetEffect(unsigned int chipIx) {
00073   assert(chipIx < m_ChipCount);
00074   return m_ChipEffects[chipIx];
00075 }
00076 
00077 /** 
00078  * @brief Get the residual (the intensity not explained by
00079  * model). Supplied as log_2() transformed.
00080  * @param probeIx - Index of probe in probe sets.
00081  * @param chipIx - Chip index in experiment.
00082  * @return intensity not explained by model.
00083  */
00084 double QuantPlierBase::getResidual(unsigned int probeIx, unsigned int chipIx) {
00085   assert(chipIx < m_ChipCount && probeIx < m_ProbeCount);
00086   return m_Residuals[chipIx][probeIx];
00087 }
00088 
00089 /** 
00090  * @brief Get the estimated intensity for a chip. This is usually the data of
00091  * primary interest. Alias for getTargetEffect()
00092  * @param chipIx - Index of chip in experiment.
00093  * @return estimated intensity.
00094  */
00095 double QuantPlierBase::getSignalEstimate(unsigned int chipIx) {
00096   return getTargetEffect(chipIx);
00097 }
00098 
00099 
00100 /** 
00101  * @brief Set the PM data at probe set probe index and chip index.
00102  * 
00103  * @param probeIx - Index of probe in probe set.
00104  * @param chipIx - Index of chip.
00105  * @param data - Data to be set.
00106  */
00107 void QuantPlierBase::setPMDataAt(unsigned int probeIx, unsigned int chipIx, double data) {
00108   assert(chipIx < m_ChipCount && probeIx < m_ProbeCount);
00109   m_PM[chipIx][probeIx] = data;
00110 }
00111 
00112 /** 
00113  * @brief Get the PM data at probe set probe index and chip index.
00114  * 
00115  * @param probeIx - Index of probe in probe set.
00116  * @param chipIx - Index of chip.
00117  */
00118 double QuantPlierBase::getPMDataAt(unsigned int probeIx, unsigned int chipIx) {
00119   assert(chipIx < m_ChipCount && probeIx < m_ProbeCount);
00120   return (double) m_PM[chipIx][probeIx];
00121 }
00122 
00123 /** 
00124  * @brief Set the MM data at probe set probe index and chip index.
00125  * 
00126  * @param probeIx - Index of probe in probe set.
00127  * @param chipIx - Index of chip.
00128  * @param data - Data to be set.
00129  */
00130 void QuantPlierBase::setMMDataAt(unsigned int probeIx, unsigned int chipIx, double data) {
00131   assert(chipIx < m_ChipCount && probeIx < m_ProbeCount);
00132   m_MM[chipIx][probeIx] = data;
00133 }

00135 /** 
00136  * @brief Return number of targets (experiments or chips).
00137  * @return target count
00138  */
00139 unsigned int QuantPlierBase::getNumTargets() {
00140   return m_ChipCount;
00141 }

00143 /** 
00144  * @brief Fill the plier parameters object based on the user-defined
00145  * key/value pairs.
00146  * The default values used for the plier parameters are from the
00147  * inputs.txt file in the sdk example.
00148  * 
00149  * @param param - Map of key/value pairs to initialize the object.
00150  * @param plierParams - Plier parameters object to fill.
00151  */
00152 void QuantPlierBase::fillPlierParams(std::map<std::string,std::string> &param, 
00153                                      QuantPlierParams &plierParams,
00154                                      SelfDoc &doc) {
00155   // unused
00156   // std::map<std::string,std::string>::const_iterator iter;
00157 
00158   float attenuation = 0;
00159   fillInValue(attenuation, "atten", param, doc);
00160   plierParams.setSeaAttenuation(attenuation);
00161 
00162   double initAugmentation = 0;
00163   fillInValue(initAugmentation, "InitAugmentation", param, doc);
00164   plierParams.setInitAugmentation(initAugmentation);
00165

00167   fillInValue(initDefaultFeatureResponse, "InitDefaultFeatureResponse", param, doc);
00168   plierParams.setInitDefaultFeatureResponse(initDefaultFeatureResponse);
00169

00171   fillInValue(initDefaultTargetResponse, "InitDefaultTargetResponse", param, doc);
00172   plierParams.setInitDefaultTargetResponse(initDefaultTargetResponse);

00175   fillInValue(seaOptConvergence, "SeaOptConvergence", param, doc);

00251 std::vector<SelfDoc::Opt> QuantPlierBase::getDefaultDocOptions() { 
00252   std::vector<SelfDoc::Opt> opts;
00253   SelfDoc::Opt optmethod = {"optmethod", SelfDoc::Opt::Integer, "0", "0", "0", "1",
00254                             "Optimization method to use for plier 1 for SEA (Simplified Expression Analysis), 0 for full Plier optimization."};
00255   opts.push_back(optmethod);
00256   SelfDoc::Opt atten = {"atten", SelfDoc::Opt::Double, "0.005", "0.005", "0", "1",
00257                         "Attenuation to use for background with SEA."};
00258   opts.push_back(atten);
00259   SelfDoc::Opt initAugmentation = {"InitAugmentation", SelfDoc::Opt::Double, "0.1", "0.1", "0", "NA", 
00260                                    "Positive number added to all values to void zero values in input data."};
00261   opts.push_back(initAugmentation);
00262   SelfDoc::Opt initDefaultFeatureResponse = {"InitDefaultFeatureResponse", SelfDoc::Opt::Double, "1.0", "1.0", "0", "NA",
00263                                              "Default FeatureResponse if not supplied."};
00264   opts.push_back(initDefaultFeatureResponse);
00265   SelfDoc::Opt initDefaultTargetResponse = {"InitDefaultTargetResponse", SelfDoc::Opt::Double, "1.0", "1.0", "0", "NA",
00266                                             "Default TargetResponse if not supplied."};
00267   opts.push_back(initDefaultTargetResponse);
00268   SelfDoc::Opt seaOptConvergence = {"SeaOptConvergence", SelfDoc::Opt::Double, "0.000001", "0.000001", "0", "NA",
00269                                     "Change in log-value at which to stop."};
00270   opts.push_back(seaOptConvergence);
00271   SelfDoc::Opt seaOptIteration = {"SeaOptIteration", SelfDoc::Opt::Integer, "2000", "2000", "1", "NA",
00272                                   "Max number of SEA iteration to avoid infinite loops in SEA."};
00273   opts.push_back(seaOptIteration);
00274   SelfDoc::Opt plierGmCutoff = {"PlierGmCutoff", SelfDoc::Opt::Double, "0.15", "0.15", "0", "NA",
00275                                 "Controls discounting outliers, larger values indicate that fewer outliers are expected."};
00276   opts.push_back(plierGmCutoff);
00277   SelfDoc::Opt plierDifferentialFeaturePenalty = {"PlierDifferentialFeaturePenalty", SelfDoc::Opt::Double, "0.001", "0.001", "0", "NA",
00278                                                   "Bayes penalty for peculiar features."};
00279   opts.push_back(plierDifferentialFeaturePenalty);
00280   SelfDoc::Opt plierDifferentialTargetPenalty = {"PlierDifferentialTargetPenalty", SelfDoc::Opt::Double, "0.000001", "0.000001", "0", "NA",
00281                                                  "Bayes penalty for really peculiar TargetResponses."};
00282   opts.push_back(plierDifferentialTargetPenalty);
00283   SelfDoc::Opt plierUseMMLikelihood = {"PlierUseMMLikelihood", SelfDoc::Opt::Boolean, "true", "true", "NA", "NA",
00284                                        "Use mm or background based likelihood."};
00285   opts.push_back(plierUseMMLikelihood);
00286   SelfDoc::Opt plierUseInputModel = {"PlierUseInputModel", SelfDoc::Opt::Boolean, "false", "false", "NA", "NA", 
00287                                      "Use provided values as the initial model of Feature Responses."};
00288   opts.push_back(plierUseInputModel);     
00289   SelfDoc::Opt plierFitFeatureResponse = {"PlierFitFeatureResponse", SelfDoc::Opt::Boolean, "true", "true", "NA", "NA",  
00290                                           "Fit Feature Response dynamically or don't update from initial values."};
00291   opts.push_back(plierFitFeatureResponse);
00292   SelfDoc::Opt plierOptConvergence = {"PlierOptConvergence", SelfDoc::Opt::Double, "0.000001", "0.000001", "0", "NA", 
00293                                       "Value of PLIER convergence, change in likelihood."};
00294   opts.push_back(plierOptConvergence);
00295   SelfDoc::Opt plierOptIteration = {"PlierOptIteration", SelfDoc::Opt::Integer, "3000", "3000", "0", "NA",
00296                                     "Max number of PLIER iteration to avoid infinite loops in PLIER."};
00297   opts.push_back(plierOptIteration);
00298   SelfDoc::Opt plierOptDropMax = {"PlierOptDropMax", SelfDoc::Opt::Double, "3.0", "3.0", "1.0", "NA", 
00299                                   "Used during descent to avoid negative or zero values."};
00300   opts.push_back(plierOptDropMax);
00301   SelfDoc::Opt plierOptLambdaLimit = {"PlierOptLambdaLimit", SelfDoc::Opt::Double, "0.01", "0.01", "0", "1", 
00302                                       "Minimum step multiplier in method."};
00303   opts.push_back(plierOptLambdaLimit);
00304   SelfDoc::Opt plierOptOptimizationMethod = {"PlierOptOptimizationMethod", SelfDoc::Opt::Integer, "0", "0", "0", "1",
00305                                              "Optimization method to use for plier 1 for SEA (Simplified Expression Analysis), 0 for full Plier optimization."}; 
00306   opts.push_back(plierOptOptimizationMethod); 
00307   SelfDoc::Opt plierOptBalanceMethod = {"PlierOptBalanceMethod", SelfDoc::Opt::Integer, "0", "0", "0", "5",
00308                                         "Identifiability method: 0 (sum), 1 (median), and 2 (SEA signal)."};
00309   opts.push_back(plierOptBalanceMethod);
00310   SelfDoc::Opt fixPrecomputed = {"FixPrecomputed", SelfDoc::Opt::Boolean, "true", "true", "NA", "NA",
00311                                  "Recompute signal after computing feature response. Set to true to get more consistent results with those generated from precomputed feature responses."};
00312   opts.push_back(fixPrecomputed);
00313   SelfDoc::Opt numericalTolerance = {"NumericalTolerance", SelfDoc::Opt::Double, "0.1", "0.1", "NA", "NA",
00314                                      "Set how strict the results should agree when using FixPrecomputed."};
00315   opts.push_back(numericalTolerance);
00316   SelfDoc::Opt safetyZero = {"SafetyZero", SelfDoc::Opt::Double, "0.000001", "0.000001", "NA", "NA",
00317                              "Set a small positive number to use in place of zero."};
00318   opts.push_back(safetyZero);
00319   SelfDoc::Opt FixFeatureEffect = {"FixFeatureEffect", SelfDoc::Opt::Boolean, "false", "false", "NA", "NA",
00320                                    "Fix the feature effect calculation to be more exect. Break when limit reached in plieralg::FitAdditiveModel()."};
00321   opts.push_back(FixFeatureEffect);
00322   return opts;
00323 }

00325 
00326 /** 
00327  * @brief Use this to toggle whether or not QuantPlier should be using
00328  * precomputed feature effects (aka feature response, sometimes know incorrectly as 'affinity').
00329  * Much faster to do as plier doesn't have to iterate through anything, but
00330  * have to make sure that the feature effects being used match the analysis that
00331  * is being done. For example the feature effects might be different using
00332  * pm-only, pm-gcbg and pm-mm adjustments.
00333  * 
00334  * @param value - true if using precomputed feature effects false otherwise.
00335  */
00336 void QuantPlierBase::setUsePrecompFeatureEffects(bool value) {
00337   m_UsePrecompEffects = value;
00338   if(m_UsePrecompEffects) {
00339     if(m_FeaturePriorEffect == NULL) {
00340       Err::errAbort("QuantPlier::setUsePrecompFeatureEffects() - Can't use precomputed feature effects without supplying them first.");
00341     }
00342     m_Plier.setPlierFitFeatureResponse(false);
00343     m_Plier.setPlierUseInputModel(true);
00344     setOptValue("PlierFitFeatureResponse", false);
00345     setOptValue("PlierUseInputModel", true);
00346   }
00347   else {
00348     m_Plier.setPlierFitFeatureResponse(true);
00349     m_Plier.setPlierUseInputModel(false);
00350     setOptValue("PlierFitFeatureResponse", true);
00351     setOptValue("PlierUseInputModel", false);
00352   }
00353 }
00354 
00355 /** 
00356  * Plier has a lot of parameters. Lets set as many as possible in
00357  * one place.  The plierParams object is initialized in the
00358  * QuantPlier newObject() method.
00359  * @param plier - plier class to set parameters for.
00360  * @param plierParams - plier parameters object.
00361  */
00362 void QuantPlierBase::setPlierParams(iaffyplier &plier, QuantPlierParams &plierParams) {
00363   plier.setInitAugmentation(plierParams.getInitAugmentation());
00364   plier.setInitDefaultFeatureResponse(plierParams.getInitDefaultFeatureResponse());
00365   plier.setInitDefaultTargetResponse(plierParams.getInitDefaultTargetResponse());
00366   
00367   plier.setSeaAttenuation(plierParams.getSeaAttenuation());
00368   plier.setSeaOptConvergence(plierParams.getSeaOptConvergence());
00369   plier.setSeaOptIteration(plierParams.getSeaOptIteration());
00370 
00371   plier.setPlierGmCutoff(plierParams.getPlierGmCutoff());
00372   plier.setPlierDifferentialFeaturePenalty(plierParams.getPlierDifferentialFeaturePenalty());
00373 
00374   plier.setPlierUseMMLikelihood(plierParams.getPlierUseMMLikelihood());
00375   plier.setPlierUseInputModel(plierParams.getPlierUseInputModel());
00376   plier.setPlierFitFeatureResponse(plierParams.getPlierFitFeatureResponse());
00377 
00378   plier.setPlierOptConvergence(plierParams.getPlierOptConvergence());
00379   plier.setPlierOptIteration(plierParams.getPlierOptIteration());
00380   plier.setPlierOptDropMax(plierParams.getPlierOptDropMax());
00381   plier.setPlierOptLambdaLimit(plierParams.getPlierOptLambdaLimit());
00382   plier.setPlierOptOptimizationMethod(plierParams.getPlierOptOptimizationMethod());
00383   plier.setPlierOptBalanceMethod(plierParams.getPlierOptBalanceMethod());
00384 
00385   plier.setNumericalTolerance(plierParams.getNumericalTolerance());
00386   plier.setSafetyZero(plierParams.getSafetyZero());
00387   plier.setFixPrecomputed(plierParams.getFixPrecomputed());
00388   plier.setFixFeatureEffect(plierParams.getFixFeatureEffect());
00389 }
00390 
00391 /** 
00392  * @brief Set up the quantification method given all the data about the probe
00393  * set, chip layout and data.
00394  * 
00395  * @param psGroup - Probes to be used for final estimate.
00396  * @param layout - Chip layout annotation.
00397  * @param iMart - Raw data from chips.
00398  * @param iTrans - Transformations to be applied to data before use.
00399  * @param pmAdjust - How to estimate background, or MM probe.
00400  * @return bool - True if setup sucessful, false otherwise.
00401  */
00402 bool QuantPlierBase::setUp(ProbeSetGroup &psGroup, const IntensityMart &iMart, 
00403                            std::vector<ChipStream *> &iTrans, PmAdjuster &pmAdjust) {
00404   unsigned int chipIx = 0, probeIx = 0, psIx, atomIx = 0;
00405   unsigned int chipCount = 0, atomPmCount = 0;
00406   float intensity = 0.0;
00407   assert(psGroup.probeSets.size() > 0);
00408 
00409   chipCount = iMart.getCelFileCount();
00410   atomPmCount = psGroup.countPmProbes();
00411 
00412   if(atomPmCount == 0)
00413     return false;
00414 
00415   /* Prepare the quantification method for this many atoms and chips. */
00416   setBounds(atomPmCount,chipCount);
00417 
00418   atomPmCount = 0;
00419   m_Probes.clear();
00420 
00421   /* Loop through and fill in the data as coming from the intensity mart. */
00422   for(psIx = 0; psIx < psGroup.probeSets.size(); psIx++) {
00423     const ProbeSet *ps = psGroup.probeSets[psIx];
00424     if(ps == NULL) {
00425       Verbose::out(1, "No probeset for index: " + ToStr(psIx));
00426       continue;
00427     }
00428     for(atomIx = 0; atomIx < ps->atoms.size(); atomIx++) {
00429       Atom &atom = *(ps->atoms[atomIx]);
00430       unsigned int channelIx = atom.getChannelCode();
00431       for(probeIx = 0; probeIx < atom.probes.size(); probeIx++) {
00432         Probe *p = atom.probes[probeIx];
00433         if(p->type == Probe::PMST || p->type == Probe::PMAT) {
00434           unsigned int probeIndex = p->id;
00435           /* If we are using precomputed probe effects fill in each probe here. */
00436           if(m_UsePrecompEffects) {
00437             if (m_FeaturePriorEffect == NULL) {
00438               Err::errAbort("No feature effects available.");
00439             }
00440             else {
00441               /// Expected feature effect is 1.0 +/- some minor adjustment. 
00442               try {
00443                 m_ProbeEffects[atomPmCount] = m_FeaturePriorEffect[p->getApid()];
00444               } 
00445               catch(...) {
00446                 Err::errAbort("Feature effect is out of bounds for probe "+ ToStr(p->id + 1));
00447               }
00448               if (m_ProbeEffects[atomPmCount] <= 0) {
00449                 Err::errAbort("The feature effect values must be positive. probe_id may be missing from the input feature effects.  probeset: "+ ToStr(ps->name) +" probe_id: " + ToStr(p->id + 1) + ", FeatureEffect = " + ToStr(m_ProbeEffects[atomPmCount]));
00450               } // Safety against log zero.
00451                           }
00452           }
00453           /* Add probe to our probes and fill in intensity data for each chip. */
00454           m_Probes.push_back(p);
00455           for(chipIx = 0; chipIx < chipCount; chipIx++) {
00456             /* PM transformation. */
00457             intensity = transformPrimaryData(probeIndex, chipIx, iMart, iTrans, channelIx);
00458             /* MM transformation. */
00459             float mmIntensity = 0;
00460             pmAdjust.pmAdjustment(probeIndex, chipIx, iMart, iTrans, intensity, mmIntensity);
00461             setPMDataAt(atomPmCount, chipIx, intensity);
00462             setMMDataAt(atomPmCount, chipIx, mmIntensity);
00463           }
00464           atomPmCount++;
00465         }
00466       }
00467     } /* atoms. */
00468   } /* probe sets. */
00469   return true;
00470 }
00471 
00472 /** Constructor. */
00473 QuantPlierBase::QuantPlierBase(QuantPlierParams &plierParams) {
00474         m_FeaturePriorEffect = NULL;
00475   /* Note: precomputed effects are not to used by iter-plier. */
00476   m_UsePrecompEffects = false;
00477   //aw: this needs to be handled by the child as self doc is not setup yet
00478   //setUsePrecompFeatureEffects(m_UsePrecompEffects);
00479   setPlierParams(m_Plier, plierParams);
00480   m_MaxProbes = 0;
00481   m_MaxChips = 0;
00482   m_ChipCount = 0;
00483   m_ProbeCount = 0;
00484   m_PM = NULL;
00485   m_MM = NULL;
00486   m_Residuals = NULL;
00487   m_ProbeEffects = NULL;
00488   m_ChipEffects = NULL;
00489 }
00490 
00491 /** 
00492  * Destructor
00493  */
00494 QuantPlierBase::~QuantPlierBase() 
00495 {
00496         //Verbose::out(1, "~QuantPlierBase() is being called.");
00497         if (m_FeaturePriorEffect != NULL)
00498         {
00499                 //Verbose::out(1, "m_FeaturePriorEffect is being destroyed.");
00500                 delete[] m_FeaturePriorEffect;
00501                 m_FeaturePriorEffect = NULL;
00502         }
00503 }
00504 
00505 /** 
00506  * Set the number of probes and number of chips to be used for estimation.
00507  * @param numProbes - Probe count.
00508  * @param numChips - Microarray count.
00509  */
00510 void QuantPlierBase::setBounds(unsigned int numProbes, unsigned int numChips) {
00511   if ((numProbes > m_MaxProbes) || (numChips > m_MaxChips)) {
00512     allocMemory(numChips, numProbes);
00513   }
00514   m_ChipCount = numChips;
00515   m_ProbeCount = numProbes;
00516 }
00517 
00518 /** 
00519  * @brief Clear out all the data.
00520  */
00521 void QuantPlierBase::clear() {
00522   unsigned int probeIx = 0, chipIx = 0;
00523   for(chipIx = 0; chipIx < m_MaxChips; chipIx++) {
00524     for(probeIx = 0; probeIx < m_MaxProbes; probeIx++) {
00525       m_PM[chipIx][probeIx] = 0;
00526         m_MM[chipIx][probeIx] = 0;
00527     }
00528   }
00529   
00530   for(chipIx = 0; chipIx < m_MaxChips; chipIx++) 
00531     m_ChipEffects[chipIx] = 0;
00532   
00533   for(probeIx = 0; probeIx < m_MaxProbes; probeIx++)
00534     m_ProbeEffects[probeIx] = 0;
00535 }
00536 
00537 void QuantPlierBase::setParameters(PsBoard &board) {
00538   string featEff = board.getOptions()->getOpt("use-feat-eff");
00539   if (!featEff.empty()) {
00540       Verbose::out(1, "Plier loading feature effects.");
00541         ChipLayout *layout = NULL;
00542         board.get("chiplayout", &layout);
00543       int size = layout->m_PlFactory.getApidMax();
00544       double *effects = new double[size];
00545       fill_n(effects, size, 0);
00546       int probeCount = QuantMethodFactory::openPrecompFeatureEffects(featEff, effects, *layout);
00547       Verbose::out(1, "Loaded " + ToStr(probeCount) + " feature effects.");
00548       setFeaturePriorEffects(effects, size);
00549       FreezArray(effects);
00550     }
00551 }
